quest.name: A Starlight Story
journal:
Damielliot beams an exultant smile at your return.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

Unable to conceal his joy at the sight of your face, Damielliot bids you tell a tale of your adventures across the realm as a special Starlight gift to the younglings. When you are ready, make for the innermost chamber, where Reauverre and his friends eagerly await you.

※Please note that you will not be able to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, check the Lodestone.

After regaling the children with a choice story from your many feats of bravery and derring-do, Damielliot invites you to retire for a well-earned rest. Drifting off to slumber, you are greeted in your dreams by what could only be one of the saint's little helpers. You awaken and rise to see a carefully wrapped gift sitting beneath the Starlight tree...

Feeling a sense of awe and wonder, you take the carefully wrapped package into hand. Could this truly be a Starlight gift sent to you by the Saint of Nymeia himself? Mayhap Damielliot might be able to offer some insight.

With a knowing smile, Damielliot explains that the gift was prepared by the children and himself, as a show of their gratitude for the kindness you showed them this Starlight─while conceding that the vision you saw suggests that other forces may have had a hand in this miracle. Should you care to bring yet more merriment and good cheer to the younglings, you are welcome to return to the children's ward as often as you like before the season is through.
objectives: Show the saint-sent gift to Damielliot.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Ah, adventurer! Your return heartens the children and me as well. I know we have imposed on your generosity quite enough already, but I was wondering─might you be willing to spare a few moments of your time?

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: In your travels across the realm, surely you have seen wondrous sights of which the children in my care could scarcely dream. It would be an ever-so-special Starlight gift to them if you could regale them with a tale of your adventures. What do you say?

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you, my friend! I am certain your story will bring them no end of wonder and joy. I will gather the children in the innermost room. Pray meet us there when you are ready to tell your tale.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Ah, adventurer! Once more, your presence illuminates our humble halls like a shining star in the sky. Have you perchance come to share another of your tales with the children?

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Thank you, my friend! Truly, your benevolence knows no bounds. I will summon the children to the innermost chamber as before. Pray join us there when you are ready.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Just look at the eager anticipation in the eyes of the chlidren, friend─they simply cannot wait to hear your tale. And I am not embarrassed to say that I am quite looking forward to it as well!

dialogue.name: REAUVERRE
dialogue.text: That's herhim, everyone! So, what story will you tell us today? My friends and I do love a good tale!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What tale will you tell the children?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of fun and games at the Gold Saucer.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of beasts wondrous and rare.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of your adventures in Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of your adventures in Gridania.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of your adventures in Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of great nations and those who lead them.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of the menace of an empire.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of primals and beastmen.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of the Dragonsong War.

dialogue.name: REAUVERRE
dialogue.text: Thank you, friend! Why, that was one of the most exciting stories I've ever heard! Well, everyone? I told you herhis stories would be the best!

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: ...Indeed you did, Reauverre. Friend, your tale was such a rousing one that when I closed my eyes, for a moment I could swear I was journeying at your side.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: But as is oft the case, joyous times pass swiftest of all, and the hour grows late. What say you rest here for the night, friend? This room is empty at the moment, and you have more than earned yourself a respite. I shall see you on the morrow.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ho ho ho! I say, it is good to see you again, my friend─ah, we have met before, have we not? It is I, the wandering pilgrim known far and wide for gifting gifts to assiduous adventurers such as yourself!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: In truth, I had a mind to wield my hammer of legend and forge for you a masterwork of goldsmithery worthy of your efforts, but I fear that my attention was required...elsewhere. But worry not, for I have procured a present which should more than suffice as a substitute!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ah, but it would seem dawn is nigh, and so I must return and do what only a Man─ah, a wandering pilgrim-man can. Until we meet again...and do remember to look under the tree!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem you have done some good this year. And so I come, bearing a gift from the Spinner. Do not ask why She chose me─surely this gaudy frock would better suit Yda, or Tataru...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Still, it calls to mind one Starlight many summers ago, when I awoke to find a small ribbon beside my pillow. Master Matoya took me to task when I suggested she was the one who had placed it there. Still, I knew the truth, and was rather moved by the gesture.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...But l have dwelt on the past long enough.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The dawn comes, and I am summoned elsewhere. Be well, friend─and do not neglect to look beneath the tree when you awaken.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Fancy meeting you here. I trust you have been a good adventurer this year?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: SheHe sure has! That's why I brought gifts! Well, a gift, at least. I'm sorry, Papalymo─I forgot to bring something for you!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Well, then it is fortunate I am not a child, isn't it? If anything, it is I who should be gifting little trinkets to you...not that I have the slightest intention of doing so.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: O-Of course, silly me! Sometimes I forget that you're so much older than me! Was it forty summers now? Fifty?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Do you see the sun coming up on the horizon, Yda? That's our cue to leave...now.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Awww, and just when I was starting to have fun! Well, see you around, Forename! And don't forget to peek under the tree when you wake up!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Sleeping like a babe, I see. Why the puzzled look? 'Tis I, the saint's little helper. Mayhap you were expecting another?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Curious, is it not? Not once did I have occasion to celebrate Starlight as a child, but now, as a man grown, I celebrate it with you─at least, in a manner of speaking.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, but dawn is nigh, and I must bid you a fond farewell. May your dreams be sweet, and do remember to peek under the tree when you awake. Till we meet again!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Hail, adventurer! By the grace of the Spinner, I, Nanamo Ul Namo, seventeenth of my line, do hereby confer upon you a gift for your most beneficent deeds this Starlight season!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: I am reminded of our own festivities at the palace, in the days when Father and Mother yet lived. The sumptuous feasts, the beatific choirs, the majestic tree that stretched up to the ceiling─would that I could take you there to see it all!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Yet alas, dawn breaks...and our time together must draw to a close. Now rise, my champion, and claim your prize!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename! I come bearing a gift from the Spinner Herself as guerdon for your most charitable deeds. That said, just between the two of us, this coat is a tad garish for my liking...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename! I come bearing a gift from the Spinner Herself as guerdon for your most charitable deeds. That said, just between the two of us, this coat is a tad garish for my liking...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: How ironic that Nymeia should choose me of all people to do Her bidding. I was a skeptical child, as you might imagine, and quick to doubt the stories of the saint. Grandfather would spare no effort in concocting elaborate tales to preserve the illusion─yet I would not yield in my pursuit of the truth. Oh, the battles of wit we had!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: While I would like nothing more than to stay and reminisce, I fear I must depart with the dawn. I shall leave your present beneath the tree. Till we next meet, friend!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: A happy Starlight to you, Forename. I come bearing a gift and a song, especially for you! Just a moment... Ahem! Trololololo～lololo～♪

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text:
On this most high and holy night,♪
The snow without lies crisp and white...♪

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text:
But love burns hot within my heart,♪
I pray that we shall never─♪

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Oh dear, is that the hour? I'll just have to sing the rest for you another time! Now, what have I forgotten? ...Oh, yes─your present! I'll just leave it under the tree, shall I? Till we meet again!

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: I trust this Starlight season finds you well, my friend? I, Aymeric de Borel, lord commander of the Temple Knights of Ishgard, have come to bestow upon you a most special gift.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: As you well know, the observance of Starlight traces its origins to my homeland, where it remains a much-beloved tradition to this day.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: I have always been quite fond of the season myself. Though I must confess that as colors go, I am somewhat partial to blue...

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Nonetheless, it is both an honor and a pleasure to celebrate this Starlight with you. So as not to disturb your slumber, I shall leave your gift beneath the tree. Be well, my friend.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Good morning to you, friend. Did you rest well?

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Good morning to you, friend. Did you─hm? You say there was something waiting for you under the tree?

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Well, well. Might it be that miracles are afoot, and the Saint of Nymeia himself has visited us to personally bestow a gift on one of his favorite little helpers?

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Haha! But forgive me my jest. The children were so stirred by your tale that they simply insisted that they return the favor in some way, and I was all too happy to oblige.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Pray accept it as a humble token of gratitude from all of us at the children's ward for the kindness you have shown us this season.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: In your dreams, you say? Well, that is most fascinating indeed. Mayhap the sound of me tiptoeing into your room at night stirred your imagination as you slumbered. Or mayhap─well, suffice to say that this is a magical season, and I would not be the least bit surprised if the Spinner Herself sought to repay you for the miracles you have worked.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: At any rate, I thank you once more from the bottom of my heart for all you have done for the children. Should you have the time and inclination to share another of your tales, I am certain they would welcome it with ears and hearts wide open...as would I.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: Another present from the children and myself. It is not much, but I do hope you find it to your liking.

dialogue.name: DAMIELLIOT
dialogue.text: I thank you once more from the bottom of my heart for all you have done for the children. Should you have the time and inclination to share another of your tales, I am sure they would welcome it with ears and hearts wide open.
